turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Southern Luzon State University.
turn.1: When was the conversion of Lucban National College into a university?
turn.2: In 1981, 20 Assemblymen of the Southern Tagalog Region sponsored the Parliamentary Bill No. 173 for the conversion of Lucban National College into Southern Luzon Polytechnic College (SLPC).
turn.3: Was there anything interesting that happened in the conversion?
turn.4: The bill was approved in December 1981 and was signed into law known as Batas Pambansa No. 145 by President Ferdinand E. Marcos.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Since then, SLPC grew to establish seven satellite campuses located in various parts of the province of Quezon.
turn.8: The first satellite campus was inaugurated in Alabat in July 1991.
turn.10: In 1991, SLPC-Polilio was created by virtue of Board Resolution No. 19, Series of 1992.
turn.11: Was there anything else that was important in the conversion?
